title: Question 40

children: A 31-year-old man is evaluated for hypotension. Over the past 48 hours, he has developed fever, diarrhea, acute kidney injury, thrombocytopenia, and the diffuse rash
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
The most likely diagnosis is toxic shock syndrome (TSS). The rash of TSS is a sunburn-like diffuse erythema that also involves the palms and soles and mucous membranes.

–associated exotoxins result in cytokine production that can result in TSS. Staphylococcal TSS is associated with tampon use, nasal packings, surgical wounds, skin ulcers, burns, catheters, and use of injection drugs. Streptococcal TSS is associated with skin and soft tissue infection, particularly necrotizing fasciitis. Clinical features of TSS may include chills, malaise, fever, hypotension, erythematous rash, and multiorgan involvement.
